item.title: Karen add a quote by Sara Teasdale
item.description:
"Stephen kissed me in the spring, Robin in the fall, But Colin only looked at me And never kissed at all.
Stephen’s kiss was lost in jest, Robin’s lost in play, But the kiss in Colin’s eyes Haunts me night and day." -- Sara Teasdale

item.title: Karen add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "Is the spring coming?" he said. "What is it like?"... "It is the sun shining on the rain and the rain falling on the sunshine..." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Aberjhani
item.description: "Now come the whispers bearing bouquets of moonbeams and sunlight tremblings." -- Aberjhani

item.title: Karen add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "When an almond tree became covered with blossoms in the heart of winter, all the trees around it began to jeer. 'What vanity,' they screamed, 'what insolence! Just think, it believes it can bring spring in this way!' The flowers of the almond tree blushed for shame. 'Forgive me, my sisters,' said the tree. 'I swear I did not want to blossom, but suddenly I felt a warm springtime breeze in my heart." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: Karen add a quote by Christoper Marlowe
